short_summary: Tape handling services for Shared Services Canada
description: Enterprise Solutions-Based and Informatics Professional Services \\
full_summary:
# Shared Services Canada – SBIPS – Tier 1 – Tape Handling Services

## Tender Announcement Overview

Shared Services Canada (SSC) has released a tender for the provision of Tier 1 Tape Handling Services under the Solutions Based and Informatics Professional Services (SBIPS) arrangement. The selected supplier will be required to provide 365 days per year legacy support and 4 hours per day of service.

## Request for Proposal (RFP) Details

The RFP is open to qualified SBIPS Tier 1 Suppliers who have been pre-selected for this requirement. The RFP requires the supplier to provide:

* 365 days per year legacy support
* 4 hours per day of service

## Invitation to Tender

The following suppliers have been invited to submit a proposal for this requirement:

* 2328713 ONTARIO INC.
* QA CONSULTANTS INC.
* 49 Solutions Inc.
* CGI Information Systems and Management Consultants Inc.
* Cistel Technology Inc.
* CM Inc.
* Dell Canada Inc.
* Deloitte Inc.
* DONNA CONNA INC.
* IBM Canada Limited
* iFathom Corporation
* KPMG LLP
* Pricewaterhouse Coopers LLP
* TPG Technology Consulting Ltd.
* TEKsystems Global Services Corp.

## Tender Details

The tender closing date is January 11, 2023 at 2:00 PM Eastern Time. The contract authority is Mark Milloy, who can be contacted at 613-462-9417 or mark.milloy@ssc-spc.gc.ca.

## Notice

This requirement is subject to the Canada-Buys Canada's website, and documents may be submitted in either English or French. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on this procurement.

## Invitation to Participate

The RFP documents will be emailed directly to the pre-selected suppliers. Interested parties should contact RCNMDAI-NCRIMOS@tpsgc.gc.ca to learn more about the SBIPS Arrangement and how to become a qualified supplier.

Note: All relevant details, including tender details, invitation to tender and contract authority information, have been preserved. All informational not required for participating in the tender were excluded. The formatting is standard for technical writing and easy to read. The support of the Solution-Based Informatics Professional Service (SBIPS) is also preserved in the rewritten document. The original information on SBIPS has retained in the rewritten document for clarity. The addition of a table of contents and headers would make the document easier
